item.title: amy add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The ground's generosity takes in our compost and grows beauty! Try to be more like the ground." -- Rumi

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You can safely assume you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "For some of us, books are as important as almost anything else on earth. What a miracle it is that out of these small, flat, rigid squares of paper unfolds world after world after world, worlds that sing to you, comfort and quiet or excite you. Books help us understand who we are and how we are to behave. They show us what community and friendship mean; they show us how to live and die." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You can either practice being right or practice being kind." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I do not understand the mystery of grace -- only that it meets us where we are and does not leave us where it found us." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I thought such awful thoughts that I cannot even say them out loud because they would make Jesus want to drink gin straight out of the cat dish." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "It's good to do uncomfortable things. It's weight training for life." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The point of marriage is not to create a quick commonality by tearing down all boundaries; on the contrary, a good marriage is one in which each partner appoints the other to be the guardian of his solitude, and thus they show each other the greatest possible trust. A merging of two people is an impossibility, and where it seems to exist, it is a hemming-in, a mutual consent that robs one party or both parties of their fullest freedom and development. But once the realization is accepted that even between the closest people infinite distances exist, a marvelous living side-by-side can grow up for them, if they succeed in loving the expanse between them, which gives them the possibility of always seeing each other as a whole and before an immense sky." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Ah, how good it is to be among people who are reading!" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I live my life in widening circles that reach out across the world." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "For one human being to love another human being: that is perhaps the most difficult task that has been given to us, the ultimate, the final problem and proof, the work for which all other work is merely preparation." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "If no one else, the dying must notice how unreal, how full of pretense, is all that we accomplish here, where nothing is allowed to be itself." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I am circling around God, around the ancient tower, and I have been circling for a thousand years, and I still don't know if I am a falcon, or a storm, or a great song." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Think... of the world you carry within you." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: amy add a quote by Kabir
item.description: "The river that flows in you also flows in me." -- Kabir

item.title: amy add a quote by Kabir
item.description: "Wherever you are is the entry point" -- Kabir

item.title: amy add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let the beauty we love be what we do. There are hundreds of ways to kneel and kiss the ground." -- Rumi

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "My heart was broken and my head was just barely inhabitable" -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Nanao Sakaki
item.description: "To stay young, To save the world, Break the mirror." -- Nanao Sakaki

item.title: amy add a quote by stendhal
item.description: "I love her beauty, but I fear her mind." -- stendhal

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "A good marriage is where both people feel like they're getting the better end of the deal." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Annie Lamott
item.description: "No" is a complete sentence." -- Annie Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "My mind is a neighborhood I try not to go into alone." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Annie Lamott
item.description: "The opposite of faith is not doubt, it’s certainty." -- Annie Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Sometimes this human stuff is slimy and pathetic – jealousy especially so – but better to feel it and talk about it and walk through it than to spend a lifetime being silently poisoned." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "It's funny: I always imagined when I was a kid that adults had some kind of inner toolbox full of shiny tools: the saw of discernment, the hammer of wisdom, the sandpaper of patience. But then when I grew up I found that life handed you these rusty bent old tools - friendships, prayer, conscience, honesty - and said 'do the best you can with these, they will have to do'. And mostly, against all odds, they do." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamont
item.description: "...for some of us, books are as important as anything else on earth. What a miracle it is that out of these small, flat, rigid pieces of paper unfolds world after world, worlds that sing to you, comfort and quiet you or excite you. Books help us understand who we are and how we are to behave. They show us what community and friendship mean; they show us how to live and die. They are full of the things that you don't get in life...wonderful, lyrical language, for instance. And quality of attention: we may notice amazing details duringthe course of a day but we rarely let ourselves stop and really pay attention. An author makes you notice, makes you pay attention and this is a great gift. My gratitude for good writing is unbounded; I'm grateful for it the way I'm grateful for the ocean." -- Anne Lamont

item.title: amy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Being enough was going to have to be an inside job." -- Anne Lamott
